title: Teen shoots himself in arm, charged with felony
content:
A Pembroke Township teenager was charged with felony unlawful use of a weapon after shooting himself in the arm on Saturday afternoon in rural Kankakee.
Kankakee County sheriff's police responded to a home in the 13500E block of 2000S Road about 4:15 p.m., where a 16-year-old told them he had been injured by a stray bullet when two cars fired at each other.
The teen was transported to Presence St. Mary's Hospital. Deputy Chief Ken McCabe, of the Kankakee County Sheriff's Department, said the teen later admitted to accidentally shooting himself with a .380 semi-automatic handgun while playing with it in his jacket pocket.
McCabe said the teen did not have a FOID card or concealed carry permits. He also said there was not any evidence to support the teen's claim two cars were shooting at each other.
"It's not entirely uncommon for people to report someone shot them after they shot themselves," McCabe said. "When you start asking questions, some things just don't line up."
